description: The coast of Asia Minor between Aeolis and Caria, known as Jaena/Jaman in Akkadian sources.

names.description: Name of Ionia in a royal inscription of the seventh-century-BC Assyrian king Esarhaddon (r. 680-669 BC) from Ashur.

names.description: Probably a name of Ionia in an administrative document discovered at Nineveh.
names.details: The reading KUR.ia-e-na is not entirely certain.

names.description: Ethnic name used to designate a person from Ionia in royal-inscriptions of the Neo-Assyrian kings Sargon II (r. 721-705 BC) and Sennacherib (r. 704-681 BC).

names.description: Ethnic name used to designate a person from Ionia in a seventh-century-BC Assyrian administrative document.
